question_text:
Divide. Use the models to help you.
$1 \div \frac{1}{5} = $_
backend_description: This image shows the division problem 1 ÷ 1/5 using colored fraction models. A single grey rectangle labeled 1 is shown, representing the whole number 1. It serves as the starting model for dividing 1 by a unit fraction. The image then shows how the whole is divided into five equal blue parts, each labeled 1/5. It visually demonstrates that five 1/5 pieces make up one whole, helping to explain why 1 ÷ 1/5 = 5.
solution: Next see how many $\frac{1}{5}$ pieces make up 1.
It takes 5 of the $\frac{1}{5}$ pieces to make 1.
solution_image_tag: This image shows a single grey rectangle labeled 1, representing the whole number 1. It serves as the starting model for dividing 1 by a unit fraction.

This image builds on the first by showing how the whole is divided into five equal blue parts, each labeled 1/5. It visually demonstrates that five 1/5 pieces make up one whole, helping to explain why 1 ÷ 1/5 = 5.
